title: Blended Instructional Design to Improve the Effectiveness of Automotive Sales Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic automotive industry knowledge and understanding of fundamental sales concepts
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, applying a hybrid approach combining theoretical learning with practical activities like role-playing.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the four stages of the automotive sales process (approach-diagnosis-proposal-closure) with 80% accuracy.
Learners can conduct customer needs analysis simulations three or more times using digital content and face-to-face practice in a blended learning environment.
By the end of the education, learners can achieve 4 points or higher (on a 5-point scale) on a Self-Determination Theory (SDT)-based learning transition assessment tool

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
